text: {{Infobox settlement | name = North Jutland Region | native_name = Region Nordjylland | native_name_lang = dan | settlement_type = Region of Denmark | image_flag = Flag of Region Nordjylland.svg | image_blank_emblem = | blank_emblem_size = | blank_emblem_type = | image_map = Nordjylland in Denmark.svg | mapsize = | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Denmark | seat_type = Capital | seat = Aalborg | leader_party = | leader_title = Chairman | leader_name = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 7933 | population_footnotes = FOLK1: Population 1 October database from Statistics Denmark | population_total = 589148 | population_as_of = 2018 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +1 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +2 | website = www.rn.dk | footnotes = }} The North Jutland Region is an administrative region of Denmark. The capital city is Aalborg. One of Denmark's five universities, Aalborg Universitet, is in the region. Most of the region's museums are in Aalborg such as Nordjyllands Historiske Museum, KUNSTEN, Musikkens Hus, Utzon Center and Aalborg Zoo. == Towns == Main townsDanmarks Statistikbank # City Population Population # City 2011 1 Aalborg 124,921 2 Hjørring 24,726 3 Frederikshavn 23,339 4 Thisted 13,005 5 Brønderslev 11,840 6 Hobro 11,635 7 Nykøbing Mors 9,154 8 Sæby 8,875 9 Skagen 8,515 10 Aars 8,010 11 Støvring 6,927 12 Svenstrup 6,751 13 Hirtshals 6,194 14 Aabybro 5,382 15 Nibe 5,043 16 Hadsund 5,040 ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:2007 establishments in Denmark
